Text: Investigate...a castle?

According to locals, it is a ruined castle that has
been abandoned for a long time. However, there
have been signs of multiple people there.
Oh, that does sound suspicious.
It could be a hideout for bandits, orâ€”
It might be a base for the Cult of Diablos?!
E-Excuse me... I got excited...

Let me say it again, your mission is gathering intel.
Even if we know something is happening there, we
don't know the enemy's strength.

You are not to take any action by yourself, do you
understand me?

Yes. My mission is to investigate movement at the
castle, and report back. I understand.
Very well.

We don't know what challenges you might face in the
castle. If the Cult of Diablos is using it as a base, then
we must hit it with the full strength of the Garden.

However, unfortunately everyone, including me,
has other missions which are of greater priority.

So, whatever forces are nesting in that ruined castle,
first I need to investigate the threat level.

Depending on who they are, we might even have to ask
Shadow to take action.

(According to the information I get, Master Shadow
might take action...! This mission...I have an
important responsibility!)

You can't expect any help from us should anything
occur, you must avoid getting into a fight. You will
be in danger.

Should it be a base for the Cult, if you carelessly
alert them to our presence then their guard will
be raised. That must be avoided at all costs.

So, you mean if we must attack, timing is important
and the full strength of the Shadow Garden will be
needed?

Yes. This is an intel-gathering mission, so you are
strictly forbidden from infiltrating, or investigating,
the castle's depths. You are only to search as far
as the castle's perimeter.

Understood. Do you think I will do something that
reckless?

...I guess not. You are not Delta, I believe in your
judgement to know when you need to withdraw.

I want to say that this is a quiet farming village,
but...just as Lady Alpha said, that ruined castle...
Something stands out about it.

But, although I've been investigating the perimeter
these past few days...there has been nothing.

Seems like no-one is going in or out, but there could
be a secret entrance which can't be seen from the
outside. If it wasn't for the tall castle walls I could
see inside.

Ah heck! I can't discover anything just by staring at
walls.

Lady Alpha said I am not to infiltrate or investigate
inside the castle, but...

Going inside is a problem, I know that, but how about
looking inside from the top of the castle walls...
Okay, let's do this.

I can stare from here all year without gaining any
intel, I need to take a little risk.

If that's my decision, then the only way is to climb
those walls...

From far away it looks high. But, with my jumping
strength I'm sure I can get over unnoticed.

But...I want to avoid landing on top of an enemy the
moment I leap over the walls. So, what other options
are there?

She barely has to hide to reach the bottom of the
wall, just cover all signs of her approachâ€”easy.

I am nowhere near Master Shadow's level, but I can
hide my presence to this degree.
Okay, so now...

Epsilon splits a part of her slime suit into a rope,
and throws it with great force up towards the sky.
There!

The magical rope-like slime dances upward into the air,
and then its movement changes, as if it has suddenly
gained a will of its own.

The slime rope stretches in a straight line up to the
top of the castle wall, without any problems or
tangles.
Yes! That worked well.

It may look easy, but magic gets unstable when it is
away from one's body. It is also difficult to maintain
the shape of slime as a substance.

Epsilon can maintain control over the direction of
the thrown rope, and its strength. This is possible
because she excels at magic control.

Strength... Yes, today my magical ability is better
than ever before. It shouldn't break when I am
halfway up. So, time to climb.

If someone was looking from the side, it would appear
as if Epsilon is just climbing the wall with a rope.

But what Epsilon is doing requires a high degree of
magic control that can't be seen with the naked eye.

Thin...but maintaining shape and strength...! Still
at the experimental stage...but going well...

It would be really hard to maintain slime thinness
and strength with magical ability in a real fight... I
wonder...if I could concentrate...

If it breaks while I'm halfway up, from this height
it would be a headlong plunge... I don't want to
imagine how that would turn out.
But, I will not do something clumsy like that...
No...guards?

Looking down from the top of the castle walls it is
possible to see a courtyard. At the back, a small
path leading into the castle can just be seen by
moonlight.

Considering this castle is "abandoned," that small
path looks like it has been heavily trampled by a
lot of people.

Just as I thought...they aren't using the front gate.
There's a secret entrance coming from somewhere
else, one hidden from prying eyes.
This is enough...perhaps I should go back?
Despite telling herself that...

(But, should I go back now? Lady Alpha's order was to
gather intel, but if I go back now my findings will just be
that I confirmed someone is coming and going.)

(Shouldn't I uncover...who is coming and going? It is
bandits, or the Cult of Diablos?)
I have come this far...I need more.

She can hear the faint voices of several people
talking. Peeking down into a main hall, she sees
several men with dirty armor.
Eek?!

If I hadn't heard the voices I would have kept going,
they would have been able to see me from below...
That was close, too close.

Looking at them, this must be the hideout for a bunch
of bandits. Damn, it isn't a base of the Cult.

Your mission is just gathering intel. Even if we know
something is happening there, you are not to take
action all by yourself.

But...she was talking about enemies whose strength is
unknown. If it's just a bunch of ragged bandits, then
I can take them out alone...

The moment she steps forward, she touches an old
lantern hanging on the wall, making a loud sound
that reverberates across the castle.
Eek?!
Oi, ya hear that?! It came from up there! Upstairs!

(Ugh... What do I do in this situation. It's just a
few bandits. Should I escape? Or...)
